data.title: What's on your to-do list?

data.text:
DO MORE

CALLING JONAS BROTHERS FANS

Are you in need of a ticket for the Jonas Brothers' Atlanta concert? If the answer is yes, head to Savannah Mall on Saturday for The Jonas Games.

The mall and 97.3 KISSFM will give away eight tickets to the concert.

The shopper-interactive Jonas Games will include: Camp Rock, Paper, Scissors (Camp Rock is the Jonas Brother's Movie); "When You Look Me in the Eyes" staring contest; "Don't Forget the Lyrics," where contestants correctly sing the next line of lyrics; "Jonas Brothers Match Game," a memory game using giant cards with pictures of Joe, Nick and Kevin; and a Super-fan contest.

DO MUSIC

JAZZ IN THE PARK 2008

What could be better than listening to jazz on St. Simons Island? The Golden Isles Arts and Humanities Association will present the Anton Harris Quartet for Jazz in the Park's fifth concert from 7 to 9 p.m. Sunday on the St. Simons Lighthouse Lawn. Bring a chair or blanket and a picnic supper.

Glynn County Schools employees and students are admitted at half price: $5. Regular admission is $10; $5 for ages 6-12; free for children younger than 6. Tickets are purchased at the gate only on the night of the concert. For information, call 912-262-6934 or go to www.goldenislesarts.org.

DO PERFORMING ARTS

"THE BEAT GOES ON" AT SAVANNAH THEATRE

Go back in time with a sampling of the greatest hits from the '60s, '70s and '80s at the Savannah Theatre. From beach blanket parties to break-dancing, the show celebrates the sounds of three generations as the cast sings its way along the musical highway of American pop hits with songs like "California Girls" and "Stayin Alive."

This weekend, there are two shows Saturday, (3 p.m. and 8 p.m.) and one on Sunday, at 3 p.m.

Other hours are: 8 p.m. Wednesdays-Saturdays and 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays through Aug. 30; Nov. 5-22; and Dec. 26-31, at the Savannah Theatre, 222 Bull St. Tickets: $16 for children; $33 for adults. Call 233-7764 or go to www.savannahtheatre.com.

DO VISUAL ARTS

GALLERY S.P.A.C.E. PRESENTS "SUCCESSION"

Get out and see some good art for free. Curtis Bartone, printer and printmaker, will unveil a collection of new and recent works, for Succession." And, the exhibit is free.

Opening exhibit is from 6-8 p.m. Friday. Gallery S.P.A.C.E., 9 W. Henry St. The display runs through Sept. 26. For information, go to www.savannahga.gov/arts.

"CROSSING TIMELINES" AT THE PINNACLE

This is the last weekend to check out Joy L. Flynn's "Crossing Timelines" exhibit at Pinnacle Gallery.

The exhibit ends Sunday.

Pinnacle Gallery is located at 320 E. Liberty St. Gallery hours: 9 a.m.-5:30 p.m. Monday-Friday; 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday; 1-4 p.m. Sunday.

Information: 525-4950 or www.scadexhibitions.com

COLLECTION OF ARTISTS

2CarGarage shows off the best of its artists in "The Best of 2CarGarage: The Collectors' Exhibition"

The exhibition will feature works by the artists represented by 2CarGarage, including Betsy Cain, Chris Kienke, Larry Levow, Elena Madden, Preston Russell, Todd Schroeder and others.
